p: The post-pandemic re-build provides a short and opportune window in which to meaningfully shift the global economy to a more sustainable pathway. The timing is important. A return to business as usual post-Covid surely represents a key milestone on the journey to global societal ruin. Swilling (2020) suggests an alternative of transformative change equal in significance to the Neolithic agricultural revolution or the Industrial Revolution. The pillars presented here are designed to inform the policy effort to rebalance the domains of sustainability and in the process, to address longer-term crises including those of climate and biodiversity loss.
